page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The area enclosed by our D Block has seen many changes since 1900.At the start of this century,most of the land was farmland and the site of Queensdale Junior School was once Queensdale farm.the areas of Filwood and Ashton were very marshy.There used to be quarries in the Knowle area and coal mines in Bedminster but these have been closed for many years now. After{World War 1,}houses started to be built throughout the area as the population of Bristol expanded.Many such houses were for the workers at the Wills cigarette and cigar factories in S.Bristol. During{World War 2,}many American soldiers were billeted in the area and underneath present day Melvin Square in Knowle is the remains of an air-raid shelter.also the area covered to-day by Filwood playing fields and
